artCategories1.name: Sculpture
artCategories1.description: Spain has a rich tradition of sculpture, from ancient Roman sculptures to modern masterpieces.

artCategories1.name: Architecture
artCategories1.description: Spanish architecture is diverse, ranging from medieval castles to iconic modernist structures.

artCategories1.name: Painting
artCategories1.description: Spanish painters have made significant contributions to art, with famous works from artists like Picasso and Velázquez.

artCategories1.name: Flamenco
artCategories1.description: Flamenco is a traditional Spanish art form that includes singing, guitar playing, dance, handclaps, and finger snaps.

artCategories1.name: Pottery
artCategories1.description: Spanish pottery is known for its vibrant colors and intricate designs, reflecting the country's rich cultural heritage.

artCategories2.name: Sculpture
artCategories2.description: Portugal has a rich tradition of sculpture, with influences from various historical periods, creating a diverse and captivating collection of artworks.

artCategories2.name: Architecture
artCategories2.description: Portuguese architecture is characterized by a blend of styles, including Manueline, Gothic, and Moorish influences. From historic castles to modern structures, Portugal showcases a unique architectural identity.

artCategories2.name: Painting
artCategories2.description: Portuguese painters have left their mark on the art world, contributing to various movements. Notable Portuguese painters, such as José Malhoa and Paula Rego, have created impactful works that reflect the country's cultural and artistic richness.

artCategories2.name: Fado Music
artCategories2.description: Fado is a traditional Portuguese music genre, often characterized by melancholic tunes and soulful lyrics. It is an essential part of Portugal's cultural heritage, expressing the country's emotions and history through music.

artCategories2.name: Ceramics
artCategories2.description: Portuguese ceramics are renowned for their intricate patterns and vibrant colors. From traditional azulejos to contemporary pottery, Portugal's ceramic artistry reflects a deep connection to its history and craftsmanship.
